page.title: 05Baptist Church and Activity
page.content: The musical tells the story of a welsh girl called Mary Jones who wants a Bible that is written in Welsh. Charlotte Clement played the part of Mary Jones. There was a choir of 70 children and adults from the community. A small orchestra accompanied the musical. This orchestra included Amy Marston, a member of the county youth orchestra which has given very well received concerts at Malvern and Leominster Priories. John Cashmore, a baritone began in 1985 with a Scottish opera touring "Carmen" by Bizet to 20 towns and cities in Scotland. The roles he played were Zuniga and Dancairo. In May he went to Dublin to perform and record for RTE Radio.
